description: Ley Line Nexus Room - A T-shaped magical room that generates 10 Flux/min, amplifies nearby magic rooms by +30%, can only be placed on ley line convergence points, supports 2-3 inhabitants.

userStories.title: Define Ley Line Nexus in YAML gamedata
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the Ley Line Nexus defined in YAML with T-shaped layout and production values.
acceptanceCriteria: ley-line-nexus.yaml in gamedata/rooms/ with id, name, description, shape (T-shaped ~9 tiles), fearLevel (2 medium), maxInhabitants (2), upgradeMaxInhabitants (3)
Production: 10 Flux per minute base rate
Placement restriction: requiresLeyLine: true
npm run gamedata:build compiles without errors
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Defined in gamedata/room/base.yml with T-shape (0279e677), flux production 2.0/tick (10/min), fearLevel 2, maxInhabitants 2, 3 adjacency bonuses, 3 upgrade paths. Ley line placement restriction deferred (system doesn't exist).

userStories.title: Implement T-shaped placement with ley line convergence check
userStories.description: As a player, I want the Nexus to occupy a T-shaped footprint and only be placeable on ley line convergence points.
acceptanceCriteria: T-shaped room occupying ~9 tiles integrates with existing shape system
Each dungeon floor has pre-generated ley line convergence points from world generation
Nexus can only be placed when footprint overlaps a convergence point
Placement UI highlights valid ley line positions
Attempting to place on non-ley-line tile rejected with message
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: DEFERRED: Ley line convergence system doesn't exist yet. Requires world generation changes (floor-level ley line data), placement validation extension, and UI highlighting. Room uses existing T-shape and standard placement for now.

userStories.title: Implement Flux production and magic amplification aura
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the Nexus to produce Flux and boost nearby magic rooms by +30%.
acceptanceCriteria: Room produces 10 Flux/min base, +2 Flux per assigned inhabitant
All magic-tagged rooms within 3 grid spaces (Manhattan distance) receive +30% production
Multiple Nexus auras do not stack on the same room (max +30%)
Aura recalculates when rooms are added/removed; implemented as computed() signal
Production paused if room damaged or has no inhabitants
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: DEFERRED: Magic amplification aura requires a global aura/modifier system (similar to Underground Lake humidity aura). Flux production (2.0/tick = 10/min) is implemented. Per-inhabitant bonus uses standard worker efficiency system. Magic room tagging doesn't exist yet.

userStories.title: Write Ley Line Nexus unit tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests verifying Nexus production, amplification, and placement.
acceptanceCriteria: Test: Nexus produces 10 Flux/min base
Test: Magic amplification +30% to eligible rooms within 3 spaces
Test: Amplification does not apply to non-magic rooms
Test: Multiple Nexus auras do not stack
Test: Placement rejected on non-ley-line tiles
Test: Inhabitant capacity respects base and upgraded limits
Tests in src/app/helpers/ spec file
All tests pass with npm run test
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: 21 tests in ley-line-nexus.spec.ts covering: definition (7), base production (3), adjacency bonuses (4), all 3 upgrades (4), mutual exclusivity (2), full production with adjacency (1). Amplification aura and ley line placement tests deferred with their respective features.
